newsitem.title: FRANCE: Gaz de France 1996 profit estimated at FR2.6 BLN.
newsitem.headline: Gaz de France 1996 profit estimated at FR2.6 BLN.

text.p: French state utility Gaz de France expects to report a rise in net income for 1996 to around 2.6 billion francs from 1.9 billion in 1995, chairman Pierre Gadonneix said on Thursday.

"The year 1996 was characterised by strong growth of around 10 percent in sales...leading to a satisfying net income of 2.6 billion francs, slightly above our forecasts," Gadonneix told a news conference.
He said the improved results enabled the utility to finance its investments in France, which rose 12 percent to 5.7 billion francs.

The results also helped to improve Gaz de France's financial situation and reduce its debt to 13 billion francs from 14.7 billion in 1995, Gadonneix said. GdF's capital rose to 13.6 billion francs from 10.9 billion.
"The result should also be satisfying for our shareholder, the state, which will receive around 1.9 billion francs in dividends and 1.7 billion from tax on profit," he said.
GdF paid the state 1.3 billion francs in dividends in 1995 and 1.2 billion in taxes.
Its gas sales rose three percent, in volume terms, in 1996 to 367 TWh.
